DOC.brief_summary: This study is to evaluate the efficacy of sodium bicarbonate plus N-acetylcysteine for the prevention of contrast-induced nephropathy.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Hydration With Sodium Bicarbonate for Long-Term Clinical Outcomes in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease Undergoing an Emergent Coronary Procedure
DOC.criteria: patients with chronic renal failure(serum creatinine >1.1mg/dl) undergoing elective percutaneous coronary intervention administered with sodium bicarbonate and/or Nacetylcysteine and/or contrast media within 72 hours. pregnancy congestive heart failure allergy to sodium bicarbonate and/or Nacetylcysteine hemodialysis
DOC.keyword: patients with chronic renal failure undergoing elective percutaneous coronary intervention
